channel.title: Good books on the Windows API
channel.description: Hey, can someone point me to some books (or other resources) on the Windows API? I feel the need to create custom exploitation tools for windows (ex. a mimikatz like program with uac bypass) but I'm not really familiarized with the API. I have already read some of Gerg Hoglund's book, "Rootkits: Subverting the Windows Kernel", and it was great, I just don't feel prepared to write something like that. Thanks in advance for the suggestions.

item.title: Good books on the Windows API
item.dc:creator: system
item.description:
This topic was automatically closed 3 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

Read full topic
item.source: Good books on the Windows API
